activities:
TRACE Inc. offers several due diligence services which gather personal information through consent, control, and participation from the individuals. Some of these individuals or entities are located in the EU or Switzerland. TRACE Inc. offers TRAC (“TRACE Registered Access Code”),TRACEcheck, TRACEselect, TRACEcertification, as well as a third-party management system for ordering and maintaining due diligence reports, all of which involve collecting varying levels of personal information.  

The personal information is provided because an individual or an entity wants to demonstrate commercial transparency or at the request of a third party committed to complying with anti-bribery policies, laws and regulations in their business transactions.  

The TRACE Privacy Policy describes the types of personal information we may collect, the purposes for which we may use the information, the circumstances in which we may share the information and the steps we take to safeguard this information.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Client, customer, TRAC holders, etc. The data is entered by users/customers of the TRACE services through online portals.
recoursemech:
International Centre for Dispute Resolution ("ICDR") / American Arbitration Association ("AAA") Safe Harbor Program 

TRACE offers various mechanisms to access, delete, correct, or update personal information electronically through the online platform, or directly through a TRACE representative by phone, email, or website. TRACE users and customers control their personal information. After utilizing these recourses, if there is an unresolved dispute as to the collection, use, transmission or retention of personal information, we have designated the International Centre for Dispute Resolution / American Arbitration Association Safe Harbor Program as our independent resource mechanism to resolve these disputes. Clients contact the ICDR at the American Arbitration Society by one of the following means:

1633 Broadway, 10th Floor
New York, NY 10019
Telephone: 01 212-484-4181 
Fax 01 212-246-7274
http://www.adr.org/ICDR
